question: [File: third_party/move/move-compiler-v2/src/env_pipeline/ast_simplifier.rs] [Function: ScopedMap::enter_scope()] [Scope management vulnerability] Can an attacker craft deeply nested Move code that causes excessive scope depth, leading to stack overflow when enter_scope() repeatedly pushes new BTreeMaps onto the maps vector, potentially causing compiler crashes during contract compilation?
